title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: teenager dies after falling from a building in leeds .
sheffield radio station licence suspended after 'controversial lectures ' .
safety talks after four deaths on a64 in two incidents .
prince harry on second day of visit to west yorkshire .
two men charged in connection with sheffield stabbing .
new david hockney exhibition opens in bradford .

documents.title: salford 24-50 leeds
text: salford 24-50 leeds

documents.title: today 's top five yorkshire stories
text: that 's all from us for today and , indeed , for this week .
we 'll be back at 06:30 on monday with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across yorkshire .
meanwhile , let 's take a look back at some of the main stories from today :
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: 'loud cough not cause for 999 call ' - police
text: here are the latest tweets from west yorkshire police 's contact centre .
staff there are on a mission to warn people that some calls to 999 just should n't be made :
ringing 999 because your neighbours cough is loud is not an appropriate use of this service # not999 # inappropriate999 # notemergency
unbelievable # whatadoofus
unfortunately , we 've heard worse .
should that be we 've heard `` hoarse '' ( sorry ) but seriously these calls are no joke for hard working staff .
if you have been running in the road and someone has beeped at you , 999 is not the number to be ringing .
# not999 # justdontrunintraffic

documents.title: call to improve 'notorious ' road
text: call to improve 'notorious ' road

documents.title: watch : 1985 meets 2017 as back to the future comes to leeds
text: a hollywood classic is getting a unique screening in leeds later this month .
back to the future is the 1985 sci-fi adventure comedy which starred michael j fox .
but it 'll always be remembered for the car which was the film 's ultimate star .
and the famous delorean has been in leeds today ahead of opera north 's live screening of the movie :
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: four years behind bars for rotherham sneak-in burglar
text: a sneak-in burglar from rotherham has been sentenced at sheffield crown court to four years in jail after being found guilty of breaking into a property in the town last october .
the court heard that neil bulcroft , 42 , of no fixed address , used an open window to break into a property in herringthorpe on friday 28 october 2016 .
he stole a haul of items including digital equipment , cash and clothing .
he was arrested in january this year after officers used forensic evidence to link him to the property .

documents.title: listen : what would prince harry look like 'as a jelly ' ?
text: on the final part of his two-day tour of west yorkshire , prince harry has met workers at the haribo sweet factory in castleford .
during the visit , harry was presented with a specially made box of sweets called harry mix .
the company 's uk works director , frank windmann , said he had prepared a very special sweet for the royal :
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: renewed appeal after fatal collision in sheffield
text: police have renewed their appeal for witnesses after a collision in sheffield last weekend in which one man died and another man was seriously hurt .
karl marsden , 25 , suffered fatal injuries in the crash which happened on station road , halfway , at about 23:40 on saturday 1 july .

police say they 'd like to talk to the drivers or passengers of a white nissan juke and a silver hatchback which were travelling in the opposite direction to the black vauxhall zafira which crashed into a barrier .
two men , aged 31 and 25 , have been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving and have been released under investigation as enquiries continue .

documents.title: rail strike to hit passengers across yorkshire
text: train passengers across north , south and west yorkshire are to be hit by further action by striking union members .
arriva rail north staff will walk out for three days from tomorrow .
the rmt union is in dispute with the companies over driver-only-operated trains , which it says would be unsafe and lead to widespread job losses .
sharon keith , regional director at northern , said : `` we are doing everything we can to keep our customers on the move during the three days of industrial action affecting our network . ''
northern said it expected to run more than 40 % of its timetable and it would have additional rail replacement buses .

documents.title: police release of leeds death fall teenager
text: the first of 14-year-old mylo johnstone , who died yesterday after falling through the roof of a disused building in leeds , has been released by police :
officers believe mylo , from bramley , went on to the site on wyther lane in kirkstall with friends last night .
forensic teams , the health and safety executive and leeds city council are now working with detectives to work out what happened .
tribute messages left at the gates outside the warehouse complex describe mylo as a `` lovely lad '' who will be `` sorely missed '' .

documents.title: 'higher petrol price could fund public sector worker pay rise ' - mp
text: putting up the price of petrol has been suggested by a west yorkshire conservative mp as a way of funding a pay increase for public sector workers .
the prime minister 's ruled out scrapping the 1 % cap although some members of her cabinet have suggested it could be lifted .
but speaking on bbc radio leeds this afternoon , elmet and rothwell mp alec shelbrooke has suggested five pence on a litre of petrol as a possible way ahead :
author: Richard Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: prince harry visits seriously ill boy
text: prince harry visits seriously ill boy

documents.title: money laundering arrest in barnsley
text: a man 's been arrested in barnsley on sus of money laundering offences .
cash totalling about £ 5,000 was also seized when police carried out a warrant at a house in hopwood street this morning .
the arrested man has since been released under investigation as enquiries continue , police say .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: cctv appeal after leather jackets costing thousands stolen in york
text: cctv images have been issued of two men police want to speak to about the theft of two leather jackets .
officers believe two men entered the robert smart menswear store on low petergate in york on saturday 1 july .
they distracted the shop assistant before leaving the store with the leather jackets , worth £ 2,098 , without making any attempt to pay for them .
anyone with information about the identity of the two men in the is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: man jailed for 13 years for stab death
text: man jailed for 13 years for stab death

documents.title: sheffield winner of bbc gardening show sees allotment 'trashed '
text: the former winner of the bbc 's big allotment challenge has been pouring out his frustrations on twitter .
sheffield gardener rob smith , who won the competition back in 2015 , says his south yorkshire allotment has been `` absolutely trashed '' by vandals :
the allotment has been trashed !
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
i got sim wireless alarms from harrolds in sheffield plus wildlife camera after they targeted mine .
crime prev officer also advised
sim wireless alarms !
really , what make etc
there are some real scum about , very few allotmenteers keep expensive things in sheds now so do n't know what they hope to gain .
steve yes unfortunately there are !
how do they become scum ?
shame on them .
many reasons i 'm sure , a few are just simply bad .
most probably drug related in some way .
that 's sad rob , i feel for you .
anything on your cctv ?
really ? ? ? ?
i did n't know that ?
how sad .
oh rob , so v sorry to see this : - ( ( hope you 've got it shipshape again
heartbreaking hope you find the culprits !
a very mean , heartless act .
pointless destruction makes no sense so sorry .
oh rob , i 've only just seen this , i 'm so sorry x
speechless , i 'm so sorry for you
ohhh !
i 'm so sorry !
why do people do this ? ? ?
envy ?
what a dam pity !
how utterly heartbreaking rob
complete bastards .
hope it does n't take too long to tidy up & hope you did n't lose anything too valuable , except time obv .
how awful- you must be devastated !
so v sad & sorry to see this rob .
our plots are our sanctuary & place of blood , sweat & tears .
deep breath & best of luck getting it fixed .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: radio station suspended for 'terror talks '
text: radio station suspended for 'terror talks '

documents.title: north yorkshire road named after blind jack of knaresborough
text: part of the harrogate bypass has been named after one of britain 's greatest civil engineers who was from north yorkshire .
john metcalf , commonly known as blind jack of knaresborough , constructed roads across the north of england between 1752 and 1791 along with his team of over 400 workers .
next month marks the 300th anniversary of his birth and now part of the a658 southern bypass has been named john metcalf way in recognition of his work .

documents.title: tributes left to leeds death fall teenager
text: flowers have been left near the site in leeds where a 14-year-old died after falling from a building .
teenager mylo johnstone , from bramley , fell through the roof of a disused building at wyther lane in kirkstall yesterday .
forensic teams , the health and safety executive and leeds city council are now working with detectives to work out what happened .
the teenager 's death follows similar recent incidents in leeds where two boys were seriously injured in falls at disused buildings .
a 12-year-old boy was seriously hurt at a disused factory in modder avenue , armley , just over two weeks ago .
and a 13-year-old boy was seriously injured at a derelict building in ninelands lane , garforth , in may .
author: Charles Heslett
Journalist, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: how you doin ' ? friendsfest lands in sheffield
text: fans of the classic us comedy friends can get their fix of the top tv show in sheffield today .
the friendsfest has arrived in hillsborough park in homage to the series which lasted from 1994 to 2004 and made household names of cast members such as jennifer aniston and david schwimmer .
the event includes a full scale replica of joey and chandler 's apartment set and memorabilia and props from the show .
you can even grab a coffee in central perk
author: Jenny Eells
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: the happy world of harry-bo ! prince visits sweet factory in cas
text: prince harry is on the second and final day of his west yorkshire trip and has stopped off for some sweets for the long journey home .
the prince has visited the haribo sweet factory in castleford , which employs more than 700 people .
during the visit , harry was presented with a specially made box of sweets called `` harry mix '' :
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: listen : poetry in motion in harrogate
text: yorkshire poet ian mcmillan has been in harrogate today on one of his famous early morning strolls .
the bard of barnsley and twitter 's poet laureate has been tweeting some first-thing-in-the-morning stroll poems , which are being turned into songs from composer richard barnard .
the event is called poetry in motion and is all part of harrogate international festivals :

documents.title: bradford community 'in crisis ' after crime spree
text: businesses in one part of bradford say they 're a community in crisis after a spate of break-ins .
the independent shops and cafes in wyke say the thefts are threatening their livelihoods .
they say they 've been targeted 26 times in recent months and the last attack was on wednesday this week .
thousands of pounds have been stolen from gift shops , sweet shops , local cafes , and the fish and chip shop .
police say they 've increased the number of pcsos in wyke in the last six months and that burglary and anti-social behaviour are a problem .
a business forum meeting has been organised between police and owners and plain clothes officers are in the area , according to the west yorkshire force .

documents.title: wakefield man charged with making explosives at home
text: a 42-year-old man has appeared in court charged with making an explosive substance at his home in wakefield .
vladimir madle of westgate , wakefield , is also charged with two drugs offences , possessing an offensive weapon and possession of an explosive substance .
it comes after army bomb disposal officers carried out controlled explosions at the house in june .
he 's due back in court next month .

documents.title: 'tag ' the jack russell locked in cage and dumped in leeds field
text: the rspca is investigating after a frightened terrier was locked in a cage and left in a field in west yorkshire .
the brown and white jack russell was shut inside the pale blue metal crate in a field off sissons road , in leeds , on wednesday afternoon :
the dog is thought to be around four years old and had a microchip , which revealed his name as tag , but the registered contact details were out-of-date .
poor little tag was quite skinny and had a very dirty coat and long , overgrown claws .
i hope someone may recognise tag or the cage and will get in touch with us so we can find out more about where this little guy has come from . ''
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: royal visit continues at leeds children 's hospital
text: prince harry has been meeting staff , patients and their families during a visit to leeds children 's hospital , on the second day of his two-day visit to the city .
his visit is in support of wellchild , a charity that works with children suffering from serious illnesses or life-altering conditions .
the prince also made time for a couple of souvenir for staff and families
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: horse rescued by south yorkshire firefighters
text: it was one of the more unusual jobs for thorne and adwick firefighters in south yorkshire this week .
hope the horse still has a sense of humour :
well done to thorne & adwick white watch who rescued this horse from a ditch .
there was neigh way we were not going to help !
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: update : police name teenager who died after falling through roof
text: a 14-year-old who died after falling through the roof of a disused building in leeds has been named by police as mylo johnstone .
police believe mylo from bramley went onto the site on wyther lane in kirkstall with friends last night .
he died at the scene as a result of his injuries .

documents.title: scarborough man sentenced to 13 years for manslaughter
text: a man has been jailed for 13 years for the manslaughter of a man in scarborough .
shaun atkinson , 49 , ( top ) was found dead with serious injuries at his home on st johns avenue on 27 december 2016 .
barry rewcroft , 51 , of raincliffe avenue in scarborough , ( below ) was cleared of murder but convicted of manslaughter following a two week trial .
his son , ruben botterill rewcroft , 20 , was also acquitted of murder following the trial at leeds crown court .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: sheffield and leeds among uk cities with highest debts
text: how much debt are you in ?
new research says people living in sheffield have average debts of £ 15,000 from credit cards and loans .
the national average is £ 13,000 .
exeter tops the list , with an average of £ 20,000 owed in consumer debts , while in leeds that figure is £ 17,000 .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: traffic and travel : major delays near skipton after collision
text: a head-on collision on the a59 at skipton has lead to the road being closed both ways between the b6265 grassington road/raikes road and the a6131 , causing big delays to traffic .
emergency services are on scene .
the road was already heavily congested with temporary traffic lights causing delays , so you may well want to try and avoid the area completely for at least the next few hours :

documents.title: bolton sign ex-bradford defender darby
text: bolton sign ex-bradford defender darby

documents.title: chase signs permanent widnes deal
text: chase signs permanent widnes deal

documents.title: 'what a lovely man ! ' - prince harry 's visit to leeds
text: prince harry is on the second and final day of his west yorkshire tour and today he 's visited the home of a seriously ill five-year-old boy in leeds .
harry met oliver rooney , his family and a group of volunteers who are transforming his garden into a safe play space for wellchild 's 300th helping hands project .
oliver 's mother , elizabeth , told the prince her son was previously unable to access the garden safely without constant close supervision and could not play with his brothers .
harry sat in the living room of family and chatted to oliver and his four brothers about school and their sleeping arrangements .
what a lovely man .
the way he interacted with the boys was fantastic and he put us all at ease .
previously , oliver has had to be kept away from the other boys because of the condition of the garden at the bottom .
now we 're all going to be able to play together .
with a family of five boys , that 's really important , and important for oliver too . ''
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: teenager dies after falling from a building in leeds
text: a 14-year-old boy has died after falling from a disused building in leeds .
the teenager was with friends at the site on wyther lane in kirkstall last night when he fell through the roof and into the abandoned building , say police .
the death of the young boy follows two similar recent incidents in leeds where two boys were seriously injured in falls at disused buildings .
a 12-year-old boy was seriously injured at a disused factory in modder avenue , armley , just over two weeks ago .
a 13-year-old boy was seriously injured at a derelict building in ninelands lane , garforth , in may .
we fully appreciate that young people can find sites such as this interesting and want to explore them .

while we would never seek to blame the young people involved in these recent incidents for what has happened we do need to remind young people of the potential dangers of entering abandoned buildings and other places , such as building sites , and we hope parents will assist us by reinforcing that message to their children . ''
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: bradford re-sign winger gilliead
text: bradford re-sign winger gilliead

documents.title: playmaker lilley signs new leeds deal
text: playmaker lilley signs new leeds deal

documents.title: man dies after being hit by car
text: a 57-year-old man has died after being hit by a car in brighouse , west yorkshire .
it happened yesterday afternoon on bradford road at about 17:00 when he was in collision with a white mercedes .
the driver remained at scene and police are appealing for witnesses .
our enquiries are ongoing into the full circumstances of the collision and we would like to hear from anyone who witnessed the incident to please get in touch with police '' .

documents.title: sheffield radio station has licence suspended
text: a community radio station in sheffield has had its licence suspended for 21 days .
iman fm is based on attercliffe road in the city .

broadcasting watchdog ofcom says it has committed `` an extremely serious breach of the broadcasting code in broadcasting material likely to incite or encourage the commission of crime or to lead to disorder '' .
in a facebook post , iman fm says the move follows the broadcasting of some `` controversial lectures '' .
it says it 's trying to remedy the situation as quickly as possible .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: cctv image released after theft at sheffield fast food chain
text: police investigating a theft at a fast food restaurant in the handsworth area of sheffield have released a cctv image of a man they would like to speak to .
it happened at about 03:15 on wednesday 28 june at mcdonald 's in handsworth road
anyone with information is asked to call 101 quoting incident number 83 of 28 june 2017 .
you can also speak to crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555111 .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: bradford gives david hockney a gallery for his 80th birthday
text: the gallery where david hockney found inspiration as a child has honoured the artist by opening a dedicated david hockney gallery for his 80th birthday .
hockney visited cartwright hall in bradford in the 1940s and 1950s .
the venue 's new permanent hockney area contains works spanning his career , and unseen photos from his personal albums .
it will host a party on sunday - his birthday - with a hockney disco and a hockneyfication station , where visitors can don a blonde wig and round glasses .
david hockney is widely regarded as britain 's greatest living painter and his exhibitions have drawn record-breaking crowds to the tate and the royal academy in recent years .

documents.title: listen : residents say lives will be 'unbearable ' with new activity centre
text: villagers in newby wiske near northallerton claim plans to turn the police headquarters in their village into a children 's holiday centre will make their lives `` unbearable '' .
outdoor education provider pgl intends to open newby wiske hall as a children 's activity centre next spring .
it 's been used as north yorkshire police headquarters for the last 40 years .
sandra barnes , who lives in the village , says people are worried .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: meat stolen from sheffield butchers
text: south yorkshire police are investigating after a quantity of meat was taken overnight from crawshaws on the moor .
emergency services were called at 06:40 to the butchers shop .
a front panel of the shop had been smashed .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: award for drive to save rare beetle
text: mp rachel maskell 's up an award for her fight to save a rare species of beetle .
labour 's york central mp has been named 'best parliamentary species champion ' for her work promoting the tansy beetles living on the river ouse around york .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : ice hockey on sledges
text: there 's a new ice hockey team in south yorkshire , where all the players sit in sledges !
they 're the sheffield steel kings and they play para ice-hockey - but it 's not just for people with a disability .
we 've been to see them practice
author: Oli Constable
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: huddersfield sign defender jorgensen
text: huddersfield sign defender jorgensen

documents.title: listen : villagers meet to discuss a64 safety issues
text: if you 've ever driven to scarborough or filey , you 'll know how congested and busy the a64 can get .
today there are two meetings which will discuss safety and the possibility of making the york to malton stretch into a dual carriageway .
four people have been killed in two separate accidents this year in a six week period at crambeck and welburn .
i 've been to crambeck to talk to villagers about their concerns .
author: Sarah Urwin
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: listen : concerns as another bank closes in yorkshire
text: there are concerns that older people and small business will be hit hardest by a fall in the number of banks on west yorkshire 's high street .
barclays closes in elland near brighouse today leaving just one bank in the town , which is also due to close .
in the last five years , more than 200 branches in yorkshire have shut .
andy caton is from west yorkshire chamber of commerce .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: cliffhanger festival kicks off in sheffield
text: this year 's cliffhanger festival in sheffield kicks off tonight .
it 's all about celebrating sheffield as the outdoor city with climbing , mountain biking , running , skateboarding and orienteering .
the festival also hosts the british bouldering championships .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: listen : dickie bird on joe root
text: a bad cold could n't stop joe root from hitting an unbeaten 184 on his first day as england captain as his side ended day one of the first test against south africa on 357-5 .
an early batting collapse at lord 's had left the hosts on 74 for 4 before root steadied the ship .
he 'll resume alongside moeen ali on 61 this morning .
former test umpire dickie bird told the bbc this morning that he believes joe root is the best yorkshire batsman he 's seen since the great len hutton :
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : paint job for sheep to try to stop rustling
text: this is a great idea .
see what you think .
a york firm has come up with this hi-tech was of trying to protect sheep from being stolen .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: sniffer dogs to be used after student drug death at sheffield 's foundry
text: sheffield university student 's union says it 'll take extra measures to stop drugs getting into its club nights .
it includes using id scanners and sniffer dogs .
the measures were agreed by the council yesterday after a review of the license for the the foundry , following a police report into drug problems there .
last month 22-year-old joana burns died after taking ecstasy during a night out at the foundry .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: new hockney exhibition in bradford
text: a permanent exhibition celebrating the work of bradford artist david hockney opens its doors today .
the new gallery at cartwright hall in the city features some of his early work and is part of his 80th birthday celebrations .

documents.title: two men charged in connection with sheffield stabbing
text: two men from sheffield have been charged in connection with a stabbing in the city at the weekend .
o'niel orville josephs , 37 , from lowedges road , and 35-year-old dwayne carl satchell , from park spring road , have both been charged with attempted murder .
o'niel orville josephs has also been charged with possession of a bladed article .
both have been remanded into custody to appear before sheffield magistrates court .
at around 03:15 on sunday morning , emergency services attended the wicker , after it was reported that two men , aged 24 and 37 , had suffered stab wounds during an altercation .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: listen : hanging basket heists in sheffield
text: now here 's something which is hard to believe .
there 's a hanging basket and flower thief in one part of sheffield .
listen to this message which was left for bbc radio sheffield .
we 'll keep an eye on what is going on and keep you up to date .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : what did prince harry do on day one of his visit to west yorkshire ?
text: it 's the second day of prince harry 's visit to west yorkshire .
today he 's going to leeds children 's hospital and will end the day at the haribo factory in castleford .
here 's a look back at day one of the visit .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: weather : dry with patchy drizzle for some
text: dry and bright to start , cloudier later .
abbie has the forecast for yorkshire .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : a64 safety talks between ryedale villagers and council officials
text: people living in a village on the a64 are meeting council officials today to discuss the safety of the road .
in the last few weeks four people have been killed while trying to cross in two separate incidents near welburn and crambeck .
carol sollit is from crambeck village neighbourhood watch :
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: prince harry begins second day of visit to west yorkshire
text: the royal visit continues this morning .
prince harry is going to leeds children 's hospital and will end his tour at the haribo sweet factory in castleford .
yesterday the prince chatted with schoolchildren at headingley carnegie stadium .
prince harry got on the pitch at a rugby league festival .
the prince was greeted by cheering crowds in leeds .

documents.title: trains are running to time across yorkshire this morning
text: if you 're heading out to catch a train or waiting on the station platform services across our region are running on time .
you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: listen : campaign launched to dual a64 between york and malton
text: a new campaign 's being launched to get the a64 turned into a dual carriageway between york and malton .
the a64 growth partnership 's made up of local businesses and politicians .
it comes as villagers call for urgent safety measures to be put in place after four fatalities on the road in six weeks .
julian rudd from the partnership group says dualling is crucial for local companies .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage from around yorkshire
text: hello .
it 's friday .
after last night 's dramatic storms in some parts it is a beautiful morning .
throughout today we 'll bring you up to date with the latest news , sport and weather from across yorkshire .
this shows how the weather can change so quickly .
after dark thunder clouds over york , a spectacular sunset .
thanks to bbc weather watcher davem in york .
if you manage to get any interesting photos or things which have made you smile , you can send it in by simply clicking here .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
